intro: Neckia serrata, commonly known as the serrated neckia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have serrated edges, contributing to its common name. Neckia serrata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and coastal areas.
